page.title: 14ECOLOGY: WOODLAND
page.content: {The copse south of Roslin Farm}has a cross-shaped series of paths and is surrounded by barbed wire. We noticed that the two main types of trees growing there are sycamore and sweet chestnut. We found a few scots pine. The only oak tree we saw seemed to be diseased. Sloe and elder formed the undergrowth at the edge of the copse. {Along the East Yar River,}upstream and downstream from Beacon Alley bridge, we found willow, sycamore, oak, ash, silver birch, pine and elder trees. By the roads and fields there are oak, willow, pine, sweet chestnut and horse chestnut. { ALLENDALE COPSE}near Rookley has one tree which is about 200 years old and the rest are about 70 years. The owner, Mr. G. P. Allen, cares alot about nature.
